reviewText:
This is a casual platformer that is fun but feels very unpolished. I'm sure a lot of work went into it, but it plays like a middle-of-the-pack student/hobbyist project. The music is pleasant and fits the mood of the game fine, no real problems there. My 8 year old will probably enjoy the game for a few hours (if the bugs get fixed). I got it as part of a game bundle, but I wouldn't pay money to buy it separately.

Some specific criticisms are:

There are stars in each level, but the game never gives you an indication of what they are for or why you should look for them/collect them. Do they have any function?

There's a typo in one of the signs that the game uses to provide gameplay instructions Press F to swift on flying mode". swift --> switch. It's minor
date: but I really expect a paid game to be well polished and not have these little rough edges.\n\nThe save/load featuer lets you resume where you left off
recommended: but it only has one save slot. If you'r e in the middle of your game and want to resume it later
hoursPlayed: but accidentally click to start a new game instead of the 'Load' button
voteText: your previous game is lost.\nEDIT: After starting the new game
helpfulPercent: the summoning power is not usable. Pressing L opens the menu
votesHelpful: but all 4 choices are there even though I only unlocked the bird. None of the options work to actually summon anything
votesTotal: and this makes the game unplayable."

reviewText: Uses public domain assets and then uses other public domain assets on top of that, which makes the game lack coherence. Look familiar?[open.commonly.cc]\n\nOriginality is dead

reviewText:
WTF AM I PLAYING!
This game is directed by Michael Bay. EXPLOSIVES EVERYWHERE!
I finished the game in just 20 minutes by defeating the last boss (I call it flying dark lord).
Killing the last boss only get you to the credits. There is no story in this game.

You control a badass invicible little blue slime. In the 1st level, you can only stomp to kill but after that you got sword, summon, shuriken, and flying bubble. Pretty much you become the most powerful slime in the entire galaxy.

There is copyrighted characters in this game such as Patrick Starfish from Spongebob Squarepants, Elsa from Frozen and some Angry birds' bird.

reviewText:
https://youtu.be/Mw-_cRXb4xU

To put it kindly this very small game that does its best to make something out of the resources it has available to it.

Or in slightly less kind terms, this game is a mess.  Visuals are a mix of resolutions, perspectives, lighting and style.  The interface is sloppy and shows incorrect labels for input.  Input that is poorly laid out and can't keep up with all the buttons a player might press at the same time.

The core gameplay is a simple platformer but the weak level design and spotty collision detection drain it of challenge and enjoyment.  The occasional boss levels offer nothing to shake up the experience.
